Title: Liverpool to kick off 2025/26 Premier League season at home to Bournemouth
Summary: Liverpool to kick off 2025/26 Premier League season at home to Bournemouth on August 15 . Defending champions Liverpool will play the first competitive match of the season . The match will be the first of the new season and kick off at Anfield on Friday, August 15, 2015 .

Title: Mokwa flood: 700 people still missing, says Niger govt
Summary: The Niger State Government has revealed that about 700 people are yet to be found following the devastating flood that hit Mokwa . Governor of the state, Umar Bago, disclosed this while receiving the Chief Security Officer to Gen Sani Sani .

Title: AC Milan open to selling Chukwueze after poor season
Summary: AC Milan is actively seeking to offload Nigerian winger Samuel Chukwueze as part of a broader effort to restructure its squad following a disappointing Serie A campaign . The club finished outside European qualification spots in Serie A . According to multiple Italian reports, the club is open to selling the winger .

Title: 54 years on, civil war legacy haunts Ondo town, no water, no schools, no aid
Summary: Foriku-Boridele in Ondo State was one of the battlegrounds during the Nigeria-Biafra conflict . The community, located near Ore, has no water, no schools, no aid .

Title: Cross River gov reshuffles media team, appoints Obogo as CPS
Summary: Governor Bassey Otu appoints Linus Obogo as Chief Press Secretary and Special Adviser on Media and Publicity, while reassigning Nsa Gill to serve as Special Adviser . Gill is the Special Adviser for Public Affairs . The appointments were confirmed in a press conference in Cross River State .

Title: Umahi terminates N35bn section 1 Benin-Sapele-Warri Road contract
Summary: Umahi terminates N35bn section 1 Benin-Sapele-Warri Road contract . Umahi announced his decision during a briefing after a meeting with GELD Construction Ltd and SKECC Nigeria Ltd .

Title: Two Iranian centrifuge production sites destroyed – IAEA
Summary: The UN agency's announcement came hours after Israel's military said it had carried out a series of air strikes in and around Tehran . The IAEA said two Iranian centrifuge production sites were destroyed .

Title: Approximately 2,000 Australian citizens register to leave Israel, Iran
Summary: Approximately 2,000 Australian citizens register to leave Israel, Iran, according to updated government data . Australian citizens have registered for assistance to leave the Middle East .

Title: Insecurity: Nasarawa Govt to establish 3 surveillance bases
Summary: Nasarawa State Govt to establish security surveillance bases in each of its three senatorial zones . The state government is set to establish the bases to enhance security across the state .

Title: Akpabio lauds Tinubu over bills establishing 3 tertiary institutions in S’East
Summary: Godswill Akpabio lauds President Bola Tinubu over bills establishing 3 tertiary institutions in S’East . The institutions are College of Education, Bende, Abia, Federal University of Medical and Health Sciences, Item and Federal University, Okigwe, Imo .

Title: BREAKING: US visa restrictions on ECOWAS countries threaten regional prosperity — Minister
Summary: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Ambassador Yusuf Tuggar has raised concerns over the apparent inclusion of all ECOWAS member states in a new wave of United States visa restrictions . He described the policy as a significant barrier to trade, diplomacy, and regional prosperity . The affected countries are expected to meet new requirements laid down by the State Department

Title: Soldiers foil B'Haram attack on Lake Chad naval base, kill dozens
Summary: Troops of Operation Hadin Kai have stopped an early morning attack by Boko Haram and ISWAP terrorists on the Naval Base at Lake Chad Fish Dam . The attack happened around 2 a.m. on Wednesday . The terrorists tried to destroy swamp bogeys recently bought by the Borno State Government to help clear waterways in the area

Title: Navy intercepts six crude-laden boats, arrests three in N'Delta creeks
Summary: Nigerian Navy intercepted and arrested a group of suspected pipeline vandals in the Chevron Nigeria Ltd. Malu Jacket 19 offshore Escravos in the Niger Delta creeks . In the sting operation, three of the suspects were apprehended on the scene while others fled in six speedboats, each powered by 200HP engines and carrying nine drums apiece

Title: VC allays farmers' insecurity fears, urges return to farms
Summary: The Vice-Chancellor of Taraba State University, Sunday Bako, on Wednesday allayed the fears of Nigerian farmers over the reported cases of insecurity nationwide . Bako made the remarks during an interview with newsmen on the sidelines of the ongoing 2025 In-House Research Review of the Cocoa Research Institute of Nigeria .

Title: Meta offered $100m bonuses to poach OpenAI employees — CEO Altman
Summary: Meta offered $100 million bonuses to OpenAI employees in an unsuccessful bid to poach the ChatGPT maker’s talent and strengthen its own generative AI teams, CEO Sam Altman has said . Facebook's parent company — a competitor of OpenAI — also offered “giant” annual salaries . Altman said
